meanings.definition: The desire to equal or surpass others in achievement.
meanings.sent1: Her emulousness drove her to work hard and strive for success.
meanings.sent2: In a competition, his emulousness was evident as he pushed himself to do better than his opponents.
meanings.sent3: The emulousness between the two friends made their friendly games of chess quite intense.
meanings.sent4: The emulousness in the air was palpable as the students competed for the top spot in the class.
meanings.sent5: His emulousness burned brightly, motivating him to constantly improve and excel.

meanings.sent1: The emulousness between the two siblings often led to playful competitions.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of emulousness among the team members, each trying to outperform the other.
meanings.sent3: The emulousness in the air was almost tangible, fueling the excitement of the game.
meanings.sent4: The emulousness between the two companies was fierce, driving them to innovate and outdo each other.
meanings.sent5: Their emulousness added an element of thrill to the otherwise mundane task.
